Post.title: Leetcode189. Rotate Array
Post.content:
https://leetcode.com/problems/rotate-array/description/

k k

1

  • nums = [1,2,3,4,5], k = 2
  • [4,5,1,2,3]

2

  • nums = [1,2,3,4,5,6], k = 3
  • [4,5,6,1,2,3]

1

  • curr (curr + k) % nums.length
    • 11 -> 3, 3 - > 5, 5 -> 2, 2 -> 4, 4 -> 1
    • 2
      • 1 -> 4, 4 -> 1
    • 2 -> 5, 5 -> 2
    • 3 -> 6, 6 -> 3

2

  • k
  • nums.length - k
    • 1
      • [5,4,3,2,1]
      • [4,5,3,2,1]
      • [4,5,1,2,3]
    • 2
      • [6,5,4,3,2,1]
      • [4,5,6,3,2,1]
      • [4,5,6,1,2,3]

1

```shell
-a Treat all files as text and compare them 
 line-by-line, even if they do not seem to be text.
-N, --new-file
 In directory comparison, if a file is found in
 only one directory, treat it as present but empty
 in the other directory.
-r When comparing directories, recursively compare
 any subdirectories found.
-u Use the unified output format.
```

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

tags:

Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

Post.title: Git submodule (Git )
Post._content:
> : https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Submodules

,  git submodule  npm packege , .

## 

 son.

#### 

- CPAN  Ruby gem. : , 
- . :  son , 
- npm package . : , ( git submodule , )

#### Git 

- git submodule (git )

## Git submodule 

#### 1.  submodule

```javascript
git submodule add https://github.com/son   // 


// 
git submodule add https://github.com/son pathTo
```

 `.gitmodules`,  submodule , . :

```json
[submodule "son"]
	path = son
	url = https://github.com/son
```

#### 2. clone 

```javascript
/**
 * --recursive c lone
 *  git submodule init && git submodule update 
 */
git clone --recursive father //  father



/* clone , ,  */
git clone father
cd father
git submodule init
git submodule update
```

#### 3. update 

```javascript
/*  submodule  */
cd son
git fetch
git merge origin/master



git submodule update --remote son
```

#### 4.  

```javascript
git diff --submodule



git config --local diff.submodule log // --global , ,  local
git diff
```

#### 5. 

```javascript
git config -f .gitmodules submodule.son.branch dev

/*  .gitmodules */
[submodule "son"]
    path = son
    branch = dev
	url = https://github.com/son
```

## 

 father ,  submodule ,  git . , , .

#### 1. 

```javascript
git checkout stable
```

#### 2. 

```javascript
/**
 *   fork 
 */
git submodule update --remote --merge

/*  */
git submodule update --remote --rebase
```

#### 3. push 

```javascript
/*  father ,  submodule  */
git push --recurse-submodules=check

/*  submodule */
git push --recurse-submodules=on-demand
```

## Git submodule

Post.title: promise A+
Post._content:
> promise A+ https://promisesaplus.com/

 promise A+  promise  promise 

## demo 

 promise [ promise](https://github.com/pearlwang1106/promise)

 promise A+ 

## 1. 

1. `promise`  `then`  promise A+ 
2. `thenable` then 
3. `value` Javascript undefined thenable  promise 
4. `exception`  throw 
5. `reason`  Promise 

## 2. 

### 2.1 promise 

 promise ****pending, fulfilled,  rejected

#### 2.1.1 promise  pending 

- 2.1.1.1  fulfilled  rejected 

#### 2.1.2 promise  fulfilled 

- 2.1.2.1

Post.title: Vuex
Post._content:
> 
> https://vuex.vuejs.org/zh/

##  Vuex

[] Vuex  Vue.js ****

 Vue 

## 

- 
- 
- 

##  store

```js
/*  */
const store = new Vuex.Store({
    state: {
        count: 0
    },
    mutations: {
        increment (state) {
        state.count++
        }
    }
});

/*  */
store.commit('increment')

console.log(store.state.count) // -> 1
```

## 



### State

>  vuex  state 

#### 

- 
    - store.state.xxx
    - this.$store.state.xxx
- 
    - mapState 
    - ...mapState({}) 

### Getter

> vuex  store  getter state  getter 

#### 

- 
    - store.getters.xxx
    - this.$store.getters.xxx
- 
- mapGetters ...mapGetters([])

### Mutation

>  store 

```js
store.commit('yourFunction')
```

- 
```js
store.commit('increment', 10)

store.commit('increment', {
  amount: 10
})

store.commit({
  type: 'increment',
  amount: 10
})

// 
this.$store.commit('xxx')
// 
...mapMutations([])
```

#### 

-  Mutation 
- Mutation 

### Action

>  mutationAction  mutation

#### 

- store.dispatch('increment')
- 
    - this.$store.dispatch('xxx')
    - ...mapActions([])
-  promsie

### Module

> Vuex  store module statemutationactiongetter

## 

### 1. dll



### 2. happypack 

js 

- 

```javascript
/* webpack.config.js */

```

### 3. tree-shaking

module  production import function  

-  node exports.a  tree-shakingstree-shakings

### 4. 

```javascript
output: {
    filename: [name].js,
},
optimization: {
    splitChunks: {
        cacheGroups: {
            common: {
                chunks: 'initial',
                minChunks: 2,
                minSize: 0
            },
            vendor: {
                test: /node_modules/, // 
                chunks: 'initial',
                minChunks: 2,
                minSize: 0,
                priority: 10
            }
        }
    }
}
```

### 5.
